revised_title: On the Oils Produced by the Action of Sulphuric Acid upon Various Classes of Vegetables
tldr: The author investigates the oils produced by the action of sulfuric acid on various plant materials, discovering that different plants yield different oils, such as furfurol and fucusol. These oils share similarities but are not identical, suggesting that the'matiere incrustante' within plants may vary between different plant types.
